alert.note: Alert for Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 6:44PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Nassau, eastern Baker, north central Clay, western Duval and south central Charlton Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 643 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cecil Field, or 11 miles west of Jacksonville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Orange Park, Middleburg, Cisco Gardens, Ortega, Oakleaf Plantation, Bellair-Meadowbrook Terrace, Bryceville, Cecil Field and Nas Jax. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
